result.execSummary:
The defendant Francis S. Bucsko was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
21 days credit.
Consecutive to: Barron County 16CF87

miscConds.notes: $250.00 DNA surcharge to be paid thru probation.  Failure to pay is a judgment.
May not possess or use firearms.

Cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost until restored, no body armor, if not US citizen face deportation or loss of other citizenship rights.

Must follow mental health regimen.
Must provide DNA sample.  Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.
